channel.description: Recent content in security on uname Linux

item.title: OpenSSL
item.description: OpenSSL is a wide spread open source cryptographic software library that contains implementations of the Transport Layer Security (TLS) and Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) protocols. Today most open source security applications utilize OpenSSL. Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS) is encrypted using TLS or its predecessor SSL. Encryption of HTTP traffic helps protect against man-in-the-middle and eavesdropping attacks and is a powerful security tool for deploying applications, even those that never see public access.
